metadata.title: CVE-2022-21722 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: PJSIP is a free and open source multimedia communication library written inC language implementing standard based protocols such as SIP, SDP, RTP,STUN, TURN, and ICE. In version 2.11.1 and prior, there are various caseswhere it is possible that certain incoming RTP/RTCP packets can potentiallycause out-of-bound read access. This issue affects all users that usePJMEDIA and accept incoming RTP/RTCP. A patch is available as a commit inthe `master` branch. There are no known workarounds.

criterions.comment: pjproject: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
